message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class Kennel {
    public static void main(String args[]) {
        String line = "";
        if (args.length < 1) {
            System.out.println("\nYou forgot to put a file name on the command line.");
            System.exit(1);
        };
        String inFile = args[0];
        Scanner sc = null;
        try {
            sc = new Scanner(new File(inFile));
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("File not found");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        System.out.println("\nThis program inputs file ");
        System.out.println(args[0]);
        System.out.println("and outputs information about all the dogs in the registry.");
        System.out.println("\nWritten by Phil Trout.");
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("Property           "+"Name                   "+"Value         ");
        System.out.println();

        ArrayList<Dog> dogs = new ArrayList<Dog>();
        Dog heaviestDog = null;
        Dog lightestDog = null;

        while(sc.hasNextLine()) {
            line = sc.nextLine();
            StringTokenizer stk = new StringTokenizer(line);
            String name = stk.nextToken();
            String breed = stk.nextToken();
            int month = Integer.parseInt(stk.nextToken());
            int day = Integer.parseInt(stk.nextToken());
            int year = Integer.parseInt(stk.nextToken());
            double weight = Double.parseDouble(stk.nextToken());
            Dog dog = new Dog(name, breed, month, day, year, weight);
            dogs.add(dog);

            if (heaviestDog == null || dog.getWeight() > heaviestDog.getWeight()) {
                heaviestDog = dog;
            }
            if (lightestDog == null || dog.getWeight() < lightestDog.getWeight()) {
                lightestDog = dog;
            }
        }

        System.out.println("Heaviest Dog: " + heaviestDog.getName() + ", Weight: " + heaviestDog.getWeight());
        System.out.println("Lightest Dog: " + lightestDog.getName() + ", Weight: " + lightestDog.getWeight());
    }

    public static class Dog {
        private String dogName;
        private String dogBreed;
        private int dogMonth;
        private int dogDay;
        private int dogYear;
        private double dogWeight;

        public Dog(String name, String breed, int month, int day, int year, double weight){
            dogName = name;
            dogBreed = breed;
            dogMonth = month;
            dogDay = day;
            dogYear = year;
            dogWeight = weight;
        }

        public String getName(){ return dogName; }
        public String getBreed(){return dogBreed;}
        public String toString(){return String.format("%d/%d/%d", dogMonth, dogDay, dogYear);}
        public double getWeight(){return dogWeight;}
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to break a string into tokens. The nextToken() method returns the next token from this string tokenizer's string. In this code, we use StringTokenizer to parse each line of the input file and create a new Dog object with the parsed data. We then add the Dog object to an ArrayList. We also keep track of the heaviest and lightest dogs as we parse the file. At the end, we print out the names and weights of the heaviest and lightest dogs.

Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
